text:
Hey Angelique - I haven't personally created a data sync with Azure, but I'm broadly familiar with the general approaches you can take.

Depending on what data objects you're looking to integrate with and what data direction you're looking for, you have a few option:

1. For HubSpot > Azure, there are a few ETL tools in the marketplace, <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/analytics-data/azure-data-studio-connector-240676|this one,> <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/analytics-data/stitch|Stitch> and <https://ecosystem.HubSpot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/analytics-data/fivetran|Fivetran> are three options to look at. You can explore the marketplace for other connectors.
2. For Azure > HubSpot, you could look at some iPaaS systems that have connectors. Workato is probably a good place to look.
3. Otherwise, you're looking at a custom API integration. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview|This is a good place to start> and then <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/understanding-the-crm|followed by this>
